        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1243872: Security: Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1243872: Security: Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      macie...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->macie...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Thu, Aug 26, 2021, 7:17 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 26, 2021, 7:17 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 26, 2021, 7:17 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1243872: Security: Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Aug 26, 2021, 7:17 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        tsepez@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tsepez@chromium.org"><!---->tsepez@chromium.org<!----></a> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<span class="line"><!----> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<!----></span><br>A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <span class="line"><!---->A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <!----></span><br><br>I had to zip things because your system has size limitations. Added .HTML and .CSS file from the ZIP in the comment.<span class="line"><!---->I had to zip things because your system has size limitations. Added .HTML and .CSS file from the ZIP in the comment.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks :)<span class="line"><!---->Thanks :)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        oh ok, <span class="line"><!---->oh ok, <!----></span><br><br>I did see <span class="line"><!---->I did see <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1208439<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crbug.com/1208439"><!---->https://crbug.com/1208439<!----></a> , when it was public.<span class="line"><!----> , when it was public.<!----></span><br>However, the difference was that in my example, I use the variable suggestedName:<span class="line"><!---->However, the difference was that in my example, I use the variable suggestedName:<!----></span><br><br>await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName: 'Dynamics.pdf.bat'})<span class="line"><!---->await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName: 'Dynamics.pdf.bat'})<!----></span><br><br>when example in 1208439 showing use of accept variable<span class="line"><!---->when example in 1208439 showing use of accept variable<!----></span><br><br>await window.showSaveFilePicker({types: [<span class="line"><!---->await window.showSaveFilePicker({types: [<!----></span><br>                            {<span class="line"><!---->                            {<!----></span><br>                                accept: {<span class="line"><!---->                                accept: {<!----></span><br>                                    'text/plain': ['.pdf.bat']<span class="line"><!---->                                    'text/plain': ['.pdf.bat']<!----></span><br>                                }<span class="line"><!---->                                }<!----></span><br>                            }<span class="line"><!---->                            }<!----></span><br>                        ],})<span class="line"><!---->                        ],})<!----></span><br><br>Maybe the fix solve both cases, but they are a bit different :)<span class="line"><!---->Maybe the fix solve both cases, but they are a bit different :)<!----></span><br><br>If you still think it is duplicated, that's fine, and I don't want to argue with that. :)<span class="line"><!---->If you still think it is duplicated, that's fine, and I don't want to argue with that.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          </tbody>

      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The issue is not limited to PDF files only. The actual type of the download through the showSaveFilePicker API can be different from what is set in the options.<span class="line"><!---->The issue is not limited to PDF files only. The actual type of the download through the showSaveFilePicker API can be different from what is set in the options.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }

          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The issue is not limited to PDF files only. The actual type of the download through the showSaveFilePicker API can be different from what is set in the options.<span class="line"><!---->The issue is not limited to PDF files only. The actual type of the download through the showSaveFilePicker API can be different from what is set in the options.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        oh ok, <span class="line"><!---->oh ok, <!----></span><br><br>I did see <span class="line"><!---->I did see <!----></span>https://crbug.com/1208439<a class="undefined" target="_blank" my example, I use the variable suggestedName:<span class="line"><!---->However, the difference was that in my example, I use the variable suggestedName:<!----></span><br><br>await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName: 'Dynamics.pdf.bat'})<span class="line"><!---->await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName: 'Dynamics.pdf.bat'})<!----></span><br><br>when example in 1208439 showing use of accept variable<span class="line"><!---->when example in 1208439 showing use of accept variable<!----></span><br><br>await window.showSaveFilePicker({types: [<span class="line"><!---->await window.showSaveFilePicker({types: [<!----></span><br>                            {<span class="line"><!---->                            {<!----></span><br>                                accept: {<span class="line"><!---->                                accept: {<!----></span><br>                                    'text/plain': ['.pdf.bat']<span class="line"><!---->                                    'text/plain': ['.pdf.bat']<!----></span><br>                                }<span class="line"><!---->                                }<!----></span><br>                            }<span class="line"><!---->                            }<!----></span><br>                        ],})<span class="line"><!---->                        ],})<!----></span><br><br>Maybe the fix solve both cases, but they are a bit different :)<span class="line"><!---->Maybe the fix solve both cases, but they are a bit different :)<!----></span><br><br>If you still think it is duplicated,            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>

        <tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Summary<!----></th>
            <!---->
          </tr>

          
        </tbody><table><tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->
              <th><!---->Issue<!----></th>
            <!---->
