        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          suggestedNameChrome.zip<b><!---->suggestedNameChrome.zip<!----></b>

        tsepez@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tsepez@chromium.org"><!---->tsepez@chromium.org<!----></a> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<span class="line"><!----> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<!----></span><br>A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <span class="line"><!---->A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <!----></span><br><br>I had to zip things because your system has size limitations.         mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }

      </style>

          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by macie...@gmail.com (Aug 26, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        tsepez@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tsepez@chromium.org"><!---->tsepez@chromium.org<!----></a> . The bug is not in a PDF file.         mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1243872#c1">Comment 1<!----></a>

        tsepez@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tsepez@chromium.org"><!---->tsepez@chromium.org<!----></a> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<span class="line"><!----> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<!----></span><br>A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <span class="line"><!---->A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <!----></span><br><br>I had to zip things because your system has size limitations.         mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        tsepez@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/tsepez@chromium.org"><!---->tsepez@chromium.org<!----></a> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<span class="line"><!----> . The bug is not in a PDF file. You can put whatever .PDF file you want. The manipulation is on HTML/JS side.<!----></span><br>A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <span class="line"><!---->A PDF file is used only to be shown in an iframe and manipulate the user to think that he runs a .PDF file in the browser. <!----></span><br><br>I had to zip things because your system has size limitations.         mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<span class="line"><!---->Save as windows show file name with extension .PDF, but the downloaded file is .EXE (possible virus)<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 92.0.4515.159 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows (possible Linux and Mac vulnerable)<!----></span><br><br>The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<span class="line"><!---->The same bug exists in Microsoft Edge.<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Video Proof of Concept: <span class="line"><!---->Video Proof of Concept: <!----></span>https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k"><!---->https://youtu.be/_GeoxvjYW7k<!----></a><br><br>To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<span class="line"><!---->To better understand the problem, I have created an example - PDF Reader with the exploit. Below we can read an example use case.<!----></span><br><br>The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<span class="line"><!---->The user read a pdf file, but after 3 seconds, he gets a pop-up to encourage him to download a file.<!----></span><br>The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<span class="line"><!---->The user downloads the file because he knows that pdf is a safe file. He runs a downloaded file and gets infected by ransomware.<!----></span><br><br>We can use any extension file for example:<span class="line"><!---->We can use any extension file for example:<!----></span><br>FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<span class="line"><!---->FileName: cat.jpg | Save as type: JPEG image (.jpg) --- but downloads cat.jpg.EXE<!----></span><br>FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<span class="line"><!---->FileName: dynamics.pdf | Save as type: Adobe Readed Document (.pdf) --- but downloads virus.BAT<!----></span><br><br>IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<span class="line"><!---->IMPORTANT - the user has to have unchecked "File name extension" in File Explorer. (By default, the option is unchecked)<!----></span><br><br>Steps to Reproduce:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to Reproduce:<!----></span><br>1. Open <span class="line"><!---->1. Open <!----></span>https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf"><!---->https://pulik.io/msexploit/Dynamics365web.pdf<!----></a><br>2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<span class="line"><!---->2. Wait 3 seconds to show pop-up<!----></span><br>3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<span class="line"><!---->3. Click on the "Download" button or any other space in the body<!----></span><br>4. Click on the "Save" button.<span class="line"><!---->4. Click on the "Save" button.<!----></span><br>5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<span class="line"><!---->5. The downloaded file is dynamics.pdf.bat (executable file - possibility for the virus - in the example just runs cmd)<!----></span><br><br>Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<span class="line"><!---->Google Team Users worth being added to CC, they were added in my last reports on a similar topic:<!----></span><br>mek@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a><br>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a><br>nattedted@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:nattedted@chromium.org"><!---->nattedted@chromium.org<!----></a><br>amyressler@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/amyressler@google.com"><!---->amyressler@google.com<!----></a><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Maciej Pulikowski (pulik.io)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<span class="line"><!---->mek@, asully@ - this seems to be another UX question on the file picker. For me, the "File name:" field is correctly labelled (file.pdf.bat), but the page has control over the text in "Save as type:". Since the filename is correct, I'm not especially worried about this, but it would be good to improve this if there's anything we can do.<!----></span><br><br>This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<span class="line"><!---->This did not reproduce for me on Linux (we wrote a file with the name 'Dynamics' to disk).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
